citation.article-title: Reclassification of marine Agrobacterium species: Proposals of Stappia stellulata gen. nov., comb. nov., Stappia aggregata sp. nov., nom. rev., Ruegeria atlantica gen. nov., comb. nov., Ruegeria gelatinovora comb. nov., Ruegeria algicola comb. nov., and Ahrensia kieliense gen. nov., sp. nov., nom. rev.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Stappia aggregata (ex Ahrens 1968) sp. nov., nom. rev.
Stappia aggregata (ag.gre.ga'ta. L. adj. aggregatus joined together, referring to the frequent formation of rosettes)
The following description is based on our own observations and on previous descriptions of the species by Rüger and Höfle (1992).
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite, but it is reduced to gas.
No acid is produced from glucose or xylose; weak or variable acid production from fructose, glycerol, and maltose occurs after 4 to 6 weeks of incubation.
The major fatty acids are 18:1 and 18:0.
The G+C content of the DNA is 59 mol%.
